name: syntheticdataset
description: Description of the variables generated by the citymodels package, with information on the sources.

fields.name: household.type
fields.description: This refers to the type of household with reference to the household owner. Optional answers were married couple, female householder no husband present, male householder no wife present and living alone. This variable was cross tabulated with race and was available in the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B11001. This was used to make a probability vector and sampled accordingly. Automatically set as 'Group Quarters' for people living in Group Quarters

fields.name: member
fields.description: For each household some assumptions were made regarding age and sex regarding at least one member of the household based off the household type. If the household type was 'Married Couple,' one member of the household was labeled the 'Husband' and another the 'Wife', as same sex marriage was not legalized in all of Texas until 2016. If the household type was 'Female Householder no husband present' or 'Male Householder, no wife present' one member was labeled 'Female Householder' or 'Male Householder' respectively. Households of 'Living Alone' had only one member labeled 'Householder.' People not defined as living in households are labeled as 'Group Quarters'. All other members 'Adult Man', 'Adult Woman' or 'Child' were determined through sampling from data established in sex and age.

fields.name: size
fields.description: Simulated size of a household- Automatically 1 for group quarters people who are not considered living in households. Household size was cross tabulated by household type and available in the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B11016. This was used to create a probability vector and sampled accordingly.

fields.name: number.of.vehicles
fields.description: Number of Vehicles refers to the number of vehicles available to the household either 0, 1 ,2, 3, or 4 or more, which was sampled from appropriate sections of the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B08201 which was cross tabulated by household size. For Group Quarters members, number of vehicles was cross tabulated by gender in U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B08014 of the US Census and used to create a probability vector and sampled accordingly.

fields.name: sex
fields.description: Variable options were either 'Male' or 'Female.' If the member was labeled either 'Wife' or 'Female Householder' the gender was assumed to be 'Female.' If the member was labeled 'Male Householder' or 'Husband' the gender was assumed to be 'Male.'The gender of all other members was sampled through data cross tabulated by race, age and gender available in U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B01001 of the U.S. Census. As sex was assumed for householders, householders were taken out of the population when sampling for age and sex.

fields.name: age
fields.description: Age was broken in to the following intervals: 'Under 5', '5 to 9', '10 to 14', '15 to 17','18 to 19', '20 to 24',  '25 to 29', '30 to 34', '35 to 44', '45 to 54', '55 to 64', '65 to 74', '75 to 84', 'Over 85'. It was sampled from appropriate intervals of the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B01001 from the U.S. Census cross U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey tabled by sex and race. Sex race and age were sampled simultaneously Householders were assumed to be over the age of 18 and sampled from the appropriate intervals. The householder population was removed from the total amount of adults when sampling ages for all other members

fields.name: race
fields.description: The U.S. Census classifies race in the following categories: White, Black or African American, American Indian and Alaskan Native, Asian, Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander, Some Other Race, Two or More Races, White Not Hispanic or Latino, and Hispanic or Latino. For our purposes we chose to neglect the White variable and use both White Not Hispanic or Latino, and Hispanic or Latino. White Not Hispanic or Latino was coded as “White” and all other variable names remained the same. Race was cross tabulated with sex and age in the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B01001 which was used to create a probability vector to sample race, sex and age simultaneously.

fields.name: school.enrollment
fields.description: Variable options were 'Public School', 'Private School', or 'Not Enrolled in School.' The variable was sampled from appropriate sections of the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B14003 which was cross tabulated by sex and age in 5 year intervals from 5 to 35 and 35 and older.

fields.name: education.attainment
fields.description: Variable options were 'Less than 9th grade','9th to 12th grade, no diploma','High School Graduate','Some College, no degree','Associate's degree','Bachelor's Degree','Graduate or Professional Degree'. They were sampled for the population 18 and older from U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B15001 which was cross tabulated by age in age groups with the following intervals 18-24, 25-34, 35-44, 45-64, and over 65.

fields.name: employment
fields.description: Variable options were: In Armed Forces, Employed, Unemployed, Not in labor force. They were sampled from appropriate sections of U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B23001 which was cross tabulated by sex and age in the following intervals: 16 to 19, 20 to 24, 25 to 29, 30 to 34, 35 to 44, 45 to 54, 55 to 64, 65 to 69, 70 to 74 and Over 75.

fields.name: disability
fields.description: Variable options were: With One Type of Disability, With Two or More Types of Disabilities, No Disabilities and were sampled from U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table C18018 which was cross tabulated by the following age intervals under 18, 18 to 64, and 65 and older.

fields.name: nativity
fields.description: Variable options were either 'native' referring to born in the U.S. And 'foreign' referring to born outside of the U.S. Responses were sampled from appropriate sections of U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B16005 which was cross tabulated by race and English speaking skills.

fields.name: English.speaking.skills
fields.description: English refers to the sample person's ability to speak English and options were either 'Speaks Only English', 'Speaks English Very Well', and 'Speaks English Not Very Well'. It was sampled from appropriate sections of U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B16005, which is cross tabulated by race and nativity.

fields.name: citizenship
fields.description: Variable options were 'Citizen', 'Naturalized Citizen', and 'Not a U.S. Citizen', People already sampled as 'native' were automatically citizens. Others were sampled from U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B16008 which was cross tabulated by nativity, English speaking ability, and age, but as age and English speaking ability were not directly sampled together, age was not used in determining sampling.

fields.name: Language.at.home
fields.description: Language refers to the language spoken at home. Sample people who were sampled to 'Only Speak English' were assumed to speak 'English' at home, other options were 'Speaks Spanish', or 'Speaks Other Languages'. Those that did not 'Only Speak English' were sampled from the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B16008 which was cross tabulated by nativity, English speaking ability, and age, but as age and English Speaking ability were not directly sampled together, age was not used in determining sampling.

fields.name: veteran.status
fields.description: Veteran status refers to whether an individual was a veteran or not, options were 'Veteran' or 'Nonveteran' and were sampled from appropriate sections of the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B21001 which was cross tabulated by sex and the following age intervals 18-34, 35-54, 55-64, 65-74, and 75 and older

fields.name: means.of.transportation.to.work
fields.description: Transport refers to how individuals get to work. Variable options were 'drove alone','carpooled','public transportation','walked','taxi, motorcycle, bike or other','worked at home' and were sampled from appropriate sections of the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B08141 which was cross tabulated by vehicles available either no vehicles, 1 vehicle, 2 vehicles, or 3 or more vehicles available.

fields.name: travel.time.to.work
fields.description: Travel time refers to the amount of time taken to get to work, variable options were less than 10 minutes, 10 to 14 minutes, 15 to 19 minutes, 20 to 24 minutes, 25 to 29 minutes, 30 to 34 minutes, 35 to 44 minutes, 45 to 59 minutes, 60 minutes or more, which was sampled from appropriate sections of the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B08134 cross tabulated by transportation method.

fields.name: household.income
fields.description: Income refers to household income which was broken into the following intervals: 'less than 10,000', '10,000 to 14,999','15,000 to 19,999','20,000 to 24,999','25,000 to 29,999','30,000 to 34,999','35,000 to 39,999','40,000 to 44,999','45,000 to 49,999','50,000 to 59,999','60,000 to 74,999','75,000 to 99,999','100,000 to 124,999','125,000 to 149,999','150,000 to 199,999','200,000 or more', income was sampled from appropriate sections of the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B19001 which was cross tabulated by race. For group quarters individuals who do not live in households this was replaced with individual income which was broken down in the following brackets: 'no income', 'less than 10,000', '10,000 to 14999', '15000 to 19999', '20000 to 24999', '25000 to 34999', '35000 to 49999', '50000 64999', '65000 to 74999', 'over 75000' sampled from U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B06010.

fields.name: health.insurance
fields.description: Insurance refers to health insurance and options were either 'private insurance','public insurance','no insurance' and were sampled from the U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B27015 which was cross tabulated by the following income intervals under 25,000, 25,000-49,999, 50,000-74,999, 75,000-99,999 and over 100,000. For Group Quarters individuals this was sampled by disability status from U.S. Census American Community 5 year survey table B18135

fields.name: householdID
fields.description: a unique ID assigned to each household or group quarters individual, generated randomly with the household type to prevent repeating an ID
